br.fml.eti.machinegun
Class Mission<BulletType>

java.lang.Object
  br.fml.eti.machinegun.Mission<BulletType>

public class Mission<BulletType>
extends java.lang.Object

To start a new mission, see Army.startNewMission(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, br.fml.eti.behavior.Factory>, br.fml.eti.machinegun.Capsule, int, int, int).

A Mission knows his Target and keep working with some thread consumers to make the "bullet" (data) reach its specified destination. A captain of a Mission is good only with a kind of bullet, because it you can say the mission "is of a specific type".

In a less abstract, a Mission is a group of threads consuming the first internal buffer to put the bullets (data) into a persisted embedded queue. Also, there are other threads consuming from this queue to execute the dirty work associated with the kind of bullet (data).

A Mission will wait (idle) until the method startTheMission() is called.

Field Detail

DEFAULT_VOLATILE_BUFFER_SIZE

public static final int DEFAULT_VOLATILE_BUFFER_SIZE
The default is 1024. Use 1 if you can't lost any data. Use big values if you have a lot of RAM memory and you don't care so much if you lost something on system crashes.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SMART_NUMBER_OF_CONSUMERS

public static final int SMART_NUMBER_OF_CONSUMERS
It will use Runtime.availableProcessors() for number of the internal buffer consumers and Runtime.availableProcessors() * 5 for the persisted queue consumers.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Mission

public Mission(ArmyAudit armyAudit,
               ImportedWeapons importedWeapons,
               Target<BulletType> target,
               Capsule<BulletType> capsule,
               int volatileBufferSize,
               int numberOfBufferConsumers,
               int numberOfPersistedQueueConsumers)
See the Army.startNewMission(java.lang.String, java.lang.String, br.fml.eti.behavior.Factory>, br.fml.eti.machinegun.Capsule, int, int, int) documentation.

Parameters:
armyAudit - to monitoring
importedWeapons - external implementations
target - destination (queue name)
capsule - a way to convert a bullet (data) into an array bytes and vice-versa
volatileBufferSize - use 1 if you want NEVER LOSS any data
numberOfBufferConsumers - more if your PC has more memory and processors
numberOfPersistedQueueConsumers - more if your PC has more memory and processors
Method Detail

fire

public void fire(BulletType bullet)
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
If the internal buffer is busy, this function will block indefinitely. But because it uses a asynchronous embedded queue, it should be very fast and non block function in most of cases.

Parameters:
bullet - The data to reach the target.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Because this function can block.

startTheMission

public void startTheMission()
Starts the internal buffer consumers threads and registers the persisted embedded queue consumers.

stopTheMission

public void stopTheMission()
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Kill all consumers (first of buffers and after persisted queue).

Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - Because it waits the threads die.
